Pre-Game Insights: Kyle Schwarber and the Philadelphia Phillies will try to get to Edward Cabrera when he takes the mound for the Miami Marlins on Sunday at 1:40 p.m. ET.
The Phillies' best power option comes in the form of Schwarber and his 33-dinger 93-RBI season, both team highs.
Bryce Harper is batting.283 with 35 doubles, 26 home runs and 67 walks.
Nicholas Castellanos is hitting.248 with 27 doubles, three triples, 19 home runs and 35 walks.
Trea Turner has a club-best.297 batting average.
Jake Burger paces the Marlins in home runs (25) and runs batted in (60).
Jesus Sanchez is hitting.247 to lead the lineup.
Otto Lopez is batting.253 with 18 doubles, a triple, four home runs and 19 walks.
Xavier Edwards has eight doubles, two triples, a home run and 26 walks while batting.328.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is scheduled for Sunday at 1:40 p.m. ET at LoanDepot park in Miami, Florida.
The Phillies vs. Marlins matchup can be watched on NBCS-PH.
The total prediction is Over 8.5 runs.
Others: The Phillies have a 7-3 record over their last 10 games.
The Marlins have a 5-5 record over their last 10 games.
